intro: Escallonia rubra var. cordobensis, commonly known as the Cordoba rosebankia, is a shrub native to South America, particularly Argentina. It features glossy, dark green leaves that are often tinged with red or purple on the underside. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, pink or red flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It is adapted to dry, sunny conditions and is often used in ornamental gardening. Its botanical characteristics make it a hardy and visually appealing addition to coastal and Mediterranean climates.
